title: Ocean sediment may contain supernova remains
content: A European research team has found sediments from the Pacific ocean floor which might be the remnants of a supermassive star's explosion. The sediments on analysis have revealed the presence of iron-60, an isotope of iron that is extremely rare on earth. Iron-60 is launched millions of kilometres across space when a supernova occurs.
author: Satyaki Das

title: Side swim style saves sharks' energy: Study
content: A recent study states that hammerhead sharks swim on their sides up to 90% of the time to save energy up to​ 10%. The study has found that these sharks swim mostly at an angle between 50 and 70 degrees due to their exaggerated dorsal fins which generate lift and help to reduce drag.
author: Satyaki Das

title: DNA study traces origin of horses' smooth ride
content: Researchers have published a DNA study stating that the gene responsible for smooth gait in 'ambling' horses first appeared in Medieval England around 850 AD. Ambling horses are known for their ability to move with a smooth, four-beat rhythm that is most comfortable for riders. The study suggests that the horses were taken from England to Iceland, and then worldwide.
author: Satyaki Das

title: Gymnast Dipa Karmakar under ‘house arrest’
content: Indian gymnast Dipa Karmakar, who qualified for the Rio vault finals scheduled for August 14, has been put under ‘house arrest’ by her coach. Reportedly, Dipa is training for eight hours everyday, with the coach having taken away her mobile SIM card to avoid “losing focus”. Dipa is the first Indian​ to qualify for an Olympic gymnastics’ final.
author: Saloni Tandon

title: Couple representing different nations at Rio
content: Sailor couple Robert and Gintare Scheidt are representing different nations at the ongoing Rio Olympics. While Robert, Brazil's all-time highest Olympic medallist, is competing under the Brazilian flag in in the men's Laser class, Gintare is sailing for Lithuania in the women's Laser Radial event. Married in 2008, the husband-wife are considered medal hopefuls for their respective nations.
author: Dishant Sharma

title: Belgian becomes oldest Olympic lifter at 41
content: Belgian Tom Goegebuer (41) became the oldest weightlifter in Olympic history, when he competed in the men’s 56 kg event at the Rio Games. Goegebuer finished at 14th place at the event, and is now looking to retire. The lifter had earlier competed at the Beijing 2008 and London 2012 Games, besides participating in the European Championships for 18 years.
author: Saloni Tandon

title: US swimmer snubs handshake with Russian swimmer
content: USA's 100-metre breaststroke gold-winner Lilly King snubbed her post-race handshake with Russia's silver-winner Yulia Efimova, who was initially banned from Rio over previous doping suspensions. "[I]f she was wishing to be congratulated, I apologize. She had a fantastic swim and I always look forward to racing her, but I was really just in the moment celebrating...", said King.
author: Dishant Sharma

title: 5.24 crore people paid income tax in 2015-16
content: The total number of income tax payers in the country is 5,24,38,971 for the financial year 2015-16, Minister of State for Finance Santosh Gangwar said on Tuesday. He added that 1.36 crore non-filers with potential tax liability have been identified by the Income Tax Department. He also said that the government identified some companies involved in the foreign exchange frauds.
author: Vaibhav Gupta

title: 'Pondicherry University' trending on Google
content: Following protests over the circulation of magazines with content reportedly against the Centre at Puducherry University, 'Pondicherry University' was a trending Google search query in India on Tuesday. It was most looked up in Puducherry, Tamil Nadu, and Kerala. 'Lindsay Lohan', 'Olympic Games Rio 2016' and 'Rafael Nadal' were some of the other trending searches in India.
author: Rahul Raj

title: Irom Sharmila rushed to hospital after breaking fast
content: Human rights activist Irom Chanu Sharmila has been rushed to hospital hours after she ended her 16-year-long fast on Tuesday. Sharmila, also known as 'The Iron Lady of Manipur', had been fasting in protest against the Armed Forces (Special Powers) Act which granted security forces extra powers. After breaking the fast, Sharmila had announced plans to become Manipur's Chief Minister.
author: Yash Kumar

title: Facebook to prevent adblockers from blocking ads
content: Facebook has made changes to its web ads to prevent adblockers from blocking ads by making them similar to its other content. It has offered users an opt-out option for targeted ads, which can be accessed under updated 'Ad Preferences'. However, opting out of ad targeting will not remove the ads completely but make them less relevant for the users.
author: Rahul Raj

title: 'Freaky Ali' trailer trending on YouTube
content: The trailer of the Nawazuddin Siddiqui and Arbaaz Khan-starring film 'Freaky Ali' was one of the most viewed videos on YouTube on Tuesday. Posted on the video-sharing platform on Sunday, the trailer has garnered over 26.72 lakh views so far. Directed by Sohail Khan and also starring Amy Jackson, the film is scheduled to release on September 9.
author: Satyaki Das

title: Jadeja fined ₹20,000 for selfie with Gir lions
content: Indian all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja was fined ₹20,000 by the Gujarat forest department for taking selfies with lions at the Gir Wildlife Sanctuary in Junagadh. Earlier in June, Jadeja and his wife Reeva took selfies at the sanctuary with lions in the backdrop, an act prohibited by law. Jadeja's father-in-law gave a statement on the cricketer's behalf and paid the fine.
author: Dishant Sharma

title: Israeli oil firm ordered to pay Iran firm $1.2bn
content: An Israel-controlled oil firm Trans-Asiatic Oil has been ordered to pay $1.2 billion to an Iranian oil company by Switzerland's Supreme Court. The dues are linked to a partnership formed before Iran's 1979 Islamic revolution. The court also reportedly ruled that there were no legal obstacles for Israel​ to pay Iran since the sanctions against Iran were lifted.
author: Parichit Mainra

title: Myanmar govt to reform $31 bn jade industry
content: Myanmar's government has announced long-pending reforms to its $31 billion jade industry. The reforms include freezing renewals of existing jade permits and suspending new ones, in an industry which has reportedly symbolised military corruption for decades. Right groups in Myanmar's Kachin, world's largest jade producer, welcomed the move but asked for a new legal framework for the industry.
author: Yash Kumar

title: Girlfriend proposes to women's rugby player post match
content: Brazil’s women’s rugby 7s player Isadora Cerullo became the first athlete to receive a marriage proposal at the Rio Olympics, after her girlfriend proposed to her at the end of a match. Post the medal ceremony at the rugby 7s final, stadium manager and Cerullo’s girlfriend of two years, Marjorie Enya, popped the question to the “love of her life”.
author: Saloni Tandon

title: Pogba to earn ₹2.5 cr a week at Man Utd: Report
content: French midfielder Paul Pogba will reportedly draw weekly wages of ₹2.5 crore ($377,000) at Manchester United, to become Premier League’s highest-paid player. Fellow United player Wayne Rooney draws ₹2.26 crore weekly, while Zlatan Ibrahimovic at third spot earns ₹1.9 crore a week. Notably, Pogba had left United in 2012 due to pay issues, after demanding weekly wages of ₹56 lakh.
author: Saloni Tandon

title: Google testing personalised version of Google Now
content: Google has started testing the personalised version of its assistant Google Now, which is integrated with Android devices and Search. A new feature called 'Explore Interests' will let users train Google Now to deliver precise information according to users' interests, like sports, movies, people, stocks and more. It will use search history, location and other details to make exact recommendations.
author: Rahul Raj

title: Google to let users order food from search page
content: Google India on Monday introduced a new feature which will allow users to order food and reserve tables online directly from the Google Search results page. The 'Place an order' option will show up when users search for a nearby restaurant on their phone and let them choose a delivery service like Zomato or Swiggy to complete the order.
author: Vani Vivek

title: Heena Sidhu crashes out of Rio Olympics
content: Indian shooter Heena Sidhu crashed out of the Rio Olympics, after failing to qualify for the women’s 25-metre air pistol final on Tuesday. The shooter finished 18th in the rankings and was out of contention to qualify for the final, in which a total of eight shooters made the cut.
author: Dishant Sharma

title: MHA issues advisory against cow vigilantism
content: The Ministry of Home Affairs on Tuesday issued an advisory to all the states advising not to tolerate any incidents of attack on individuals in the name of cow protection. It added that while cow slaughter would be considered an offence wherever it is prohibited by law, no individual is entitled to punish offenders and doing so would invite punishment.
author: Chhavi Tyagi

title: Arunachal villages work to save red pandas
content: Two villages in Arunachal Pradesh, Lumpo and Muchut, have created a zone specifically dedicated to the protection of forests for the endangered red pandas to thrive. Notably, hunting is banned in the region and the villagers carry out joint patrols twice a year with the help of WWF to prevent poaching.
author: Rini Kapoor

title: India summons Pak envoy over cross border terror
content: India's Foreign Secretary S Jaishankar on Tuesday summoned Pakistan's High Commissioner Abdul Basit for its continued support to cross-border terrorism in Jammu and Kashmir. This comes after a strong démarche (political initiative) was issued to Pakistan, referring to Lashkar-e-Taiba terrorist Bahadur Ali alias Abu Saifullah, who was nabbed by security forces during a recent J&K encounter.
author: Chhavi Tyagi

title: Monster was once valued at $8.4 billion
content: Job portal Monster Worldwide, which was acquired for $429 million by Randstad Holding on Tuesday, was once valued at $8.4 billion. Its stock peaked at over $86 per share in March 2000, valuing the company at almost $8.4 billion. However, the company was valued at $328 milllion when the markets closed on Tuesday.
author: Pragya Swastik

title: Disabled Russian builds autopilot for wheelchair
content: Russian computer scientist Valery Spiridonov has built an autopilot system for wheelchairs. The device, which can be attached to any electric wheelchair, uses cameras and sensors to map surroundings, enabling users to control their chairs via voice command on a smartphone app. Victim of a degenerative muscular disease, Spiridonov has volunteered to have the world's first head transplant surgery.
author: Satyaki Das
